metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6323 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The makecontext function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.25 creates execution contexts incompatible with the unwinder on ARM EABI (32-bit) platforms, which might allow context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (hang), as demonstrated by applications compiled using gccgo, related to backtrace generation. Andreas Schwab discovered that the GNU C Library on ARM 32-bit platforms did not properly set up execution contexts. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6323` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc-bin - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc6 - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc6-amd64 - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc6-armel - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc6-i386 - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc6-pic - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc6-ppc64 - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc6-s390 - 2.23-0ubuntu6
libc6-x32 - 2.23-0ubuntu6
locales - 2.23-0ubuntu6
locales-all - 2.23-0ubuntu6
multiarch-support - 2.23-0ubuntu6
nscd - 2.23-0ubuntu6
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> debian/patches/git-updates.diff contains the fix in yakkety+

criterions.comment: glibc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.23-0ubuntu6').
